src.model.evaluate

Helper functions for evaluating models.

src.model.evaluate.append_array_to_scores(scores, metric_array, name)[source]

Append an array of scores to a scores dictionary. Elements of the array are appended as key:value pairs.

Parameters:

  • scores (dict) – scoring dict

  • metric_array (np.array) – array of scores

  • name (str) – name of metric

Returns:

dictionary of scores

Return type:

dict

src.model.evaluate.compile_scores(y, y_pred, y_pred_proba)[source]

Compile a dictionary of evaluation metrics.

Parameters:

  • y (pd.Series) – target

  • y_pred (pd.Series) – predicted target

  • y_pred_proba (pd.Series) – predicted probabilities

Returns:

evaluation metrics

Return type:

dict

src.model.evaluate.custom_cv(train_size, test_size)[source]

Create a custom cross-validation object.

Parameters:

  • train_size (int) – number of consecutive seasons to train on

  • test_size (int) – number of consecutive seasons to test on

Returns:

cross-validation object

Return type:

mlxtend.evaluate.time_series_split.GroupTimeSeriesSplit

src.model.evaluate.custom_scorer(pipeline, X, y)[source]

Score model using a variety of metrics.

Parameters:

  • pipeline (sklearn.pipeline.Pipeline) – pipeline to evaluate

  • X (pd.DataFrame) – features

  • y (pd.Series) – target

Returns:

evaluation metrics

Return type:

dict

src.model.evaluate.evaluate_model(pipeline, X, y, cv)[source]

Evaluate model using a variety of metrics.

Parameters:

  • pipeline (sklearn.pipeline.Pipeline) – pipeline to evaluate

  • X (pd.DataFrame) – features

  • y (pd.Series) – target

  • cv (function) – cross-validation object

Returns:

evaluation metrics

Return type:

pd.DataFrame
